intro: Ormocarpum umbellatum, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive umbrella-like arrangement of small white flowers. Its root system is fibrous and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine. The plant thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
